org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.report

Class ValidationReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.report.ValidationReport

  • public final class ValidationReport
extends Object
    A validation report

    A report is a map of Messages, with the path into the validated instance where the error occurred as a supplementary information.

    You can retrieve messages either as a list of plain strings or JSON (either an object or an array).

    See Also:
    JsonSchema.validate(JsonNode)

      Create a new validation report with ROOT as an instance path

        public ValidationReport()

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public JsonPointer getPath()
        Get the current path of this report
        Returns:
        the path

      • setPath

        public void setPath(JsonPointer path)
        Set the current path of this report
        Parameters:
        path - the path

      • addMessage

        public boolean addMessage(Message message)
        Add one validation message to the report

        The message will be added to the already existing list of messages for the current path (see getPath(), setPath(JsonPointer)).

        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Returns:
        true if the added message is fatal, or if fatal is already true

      • addMessages

        public void addMessages(Collection<Message> messages)
        Add several validation messages to the report
        Parameters:
        messages - the collection of messages

      • isSuccess

        public boolean isSuccess()
        Is this report a success?
        Returns:
        true if the message map is empty

      • hasFatalError

        public boolean hasFatalError()
        Was there a fatal error during validation?

        This implementation currently considers that all URI resolution failures are fatal errors.

        Returns:
        true if a fatal error has been encountered

      • mergeWith

        public void mergeWith(ValidationReport other)
        Merge with another validation report

        Note that if a fatal error has been encountered, only the message describing this fatal error will make it into the report. Other messages are discarded.

        Parameters:
        other - the report to merge with

      • copy

        public ValidationReport copy()
        Make a copy of this validation report, with an empty message map and the current path.
        Returns:
        the new report

      • getMessages

        public List<String> getMessages()
        Get a flat list of validation messages as strings

        One message has the form:

             "/pointer/here": message here

        The list is sorted by pointer.

        Returns:
        the list of messages

      • asJsonObject

        public JsonNode asJsonObject()
        Retrieve all messages as a JSON object

        The retrieved JSON document is an object where:

        • keys are string representations of JsonPointers,
        • values are arrays of objects where each individual object is the JSON representation of one message.

        Note: the returned JsonNode is mutable.

        Returns:
        a JSON object with all validation messages
        See Also:
        Message.toJsonNode()

      • asJsonArray

        public JsonNode asJsonArray()
        Return the list of validation messages as a JSON array

        This method makes its best to order validation messages correctly.

        Each message in the resulting array is a JSON object, with the contents of the Message and with an added member named path, which contains the path into the instance where the error has occurred (as a JsonPointer).

        Returns:
        a JSON array with all validation messages
        See Also:
        Message.toJsonNode()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
